content:
Art. 4.13. 
Principle of substitution
Substitution allows the descendants of a successor to take his place in the succession and to be called to it to his degree.
Substitution takes place, in accordance with the rules set out below, in the event of the predecease, simultaneous death, renunciation or unworthiness of a successor.
 A person may take the place of the person whose succession he has renounced.
